ven and a half feet tall at the top of his

brought his large axe into a ready
> position.

emale voice that was somehow almost right next

signature of the other who came through here

 seemed to almost melt out of the jungle's brush line and on

<NEW - WHEELIE>

At =
this point, WHEELIE had found two things.  That this group was not exactly =
friends, but nor were they enemies.  Not registering them on his sensors, a=
nd not seeing any faction insignias upon them made him much more cautious. =
 But they also did not seem like Unicronians, for such would have attacked =
him or tried to play a sort of game.  So, with his energon slingshot over i=
n his hand, and still charged, glancing up at the group he gave a bit of a =
bow.

Then, piping up, "As much as it intrigues me to say, you are a myster=
y that we have found out today."  Wheelie continued, going on, "And I don't=
 know, why are you here, what do you do, and whom was the one here that you=
 spoke of that do?"  His speach falling into old patterns now.

Glancing at=
 the female, whom had identified herself as ASTRA, WHEELIE then spoke, "HOw=
 does one know who would stamp out life?  For in this world, many are here =
who give strife?  It is better to know, when knows one does not, who is an =
enemy and who shall not rot.  For when one sees what one does not know, a d=
irect method is the way to go.  For I do not konw if you are my friend.."  =
Tapping at his Autobot symbol, and hten pointing at their lack of insignia.=
  "And I do not konw if you are my enemy, and thus I must be ready to defen=
d.  So, in that case, the way to go..  Is do something that will let out th=
e emotion and it to flow."

Still glancing up at ASTRA and FIREHORN warily,=
 he continued his speaking, "I do not know for whom you fight, or if you wi=
ll try to send me into this bad night.  But for what I know, and what you h=
ave here, something strange is about, and it is near.  I go in search of my=
 friend, to find out if he has met his end.  I do not know if he was who ca=
me near this place, or someone else did who showed his face.  So please, do=
 let me know, what you hae seen and has come to go."

Telling, essentially,=
 'why' he had acted the way he did in his own roundabout style to try and b=
ait them, to see if they would attack him or restrain themselves and thus b=
e identifiable.  And explaining that he had done so by their lack of factio=
n insignia and the fact that there were many possible enemies on this plane=
t, and thus one could never assume whom anyone was an ally of, or an enemy.=
